value: File:San Francisco Church and Convent, Sombrerete, Zacatecas (25-10-2005).jpg

Established as a mining centre in colonial times, the city of
remains a traditional town with plenty of heritage to see. The river Diezmo runs right through the city.

Quite many colonial buildings have survived the test of time. The pleasant old town still has its colonial layout of alleys and squares and a rather historic atmosphere. Many of the best sights are scattered on and around the main plaza, including the 16th century
. There's a small city museum with a collection on the region's history, going back to pre-Hispanic times.
